title: Jason Gardiner has concerns over Dancing On Ice same-sex couples
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Jason Gardiner has expressed concerns over same sex pairings on Dancing On Ice, saying how he hopes it’s handled ‘correctly and with dignity’.

Ian Watkins aka ‘H’ from Steps will make UK show history by becoming the first contestant to be paired up in a same-sex dance couple – beating BBC rival Strictly Come Dancing.

The decision was made following the departure of head judge Jason Gardiner, who will be replaced by John Barrowman on the new series next year.

Speaking on Channel 5’s Jeremy Vine show, Jason has since spoken out on the decision and expressed concerns over how ITV will treat the matter.

‘All I hope is that it isn’t tokenism,’ Jason said about the move. ‘That they don’t make it camp and flamboyant and it’s a proper partnership because it has to also have that romance.’

He added: ‘I hope it is handled correctly and with dignity. I hope it’s not made light of.’

Jason Gardiner on Jeremy Vine (Picture: Channel 5)

Asked if he fears it won’t be handled properly, Jason replied: ‘Well, it is ITV. Sorry ITV, but you know, it’s true.’

Jason however hopes the network will use the opportunity to break gay stereotypes often seen on TV.

‘Will it become stereotypical? On mainstream media we’re fine to do camp with gay men, but we don’t want gay men to be romantic,’ Jason said. ‘We don’t really want to see that.

‘This is an opportunity for them to break the ice.’

H from Steps will be paired up with Matt Evers on the show (Picture: Ian H Watkins)

Jason’s replacement John Barrowman also recently spoke about the decision, calling for the LGBTQ community to throw their support behind it.

‘You know what, it’s a same-sex partnership,’ Barrowman said. ‘It’s the first. Let’s do it this way, be supportive as a community, the LGBTQ community and everybody else.

‘Let’s be supportive of this and let’s see how they do. Let’s see if they’re gonna be good.’

Dancing On Ice returns for a new series on ITV in January 2020.
